chapter.title: Java EE Policy Agents
chapter.para: This chapter concerns OpenAM Java EE policy agents. Java EE policy agents run in web application containers and protect Java EE applications.

listitem.para: A new Java EE policy agent for JBoss 7 has been added. The new agent simplifies integration with JBoss AS 7 (EAP 6) application servers by leveraging the module system introduced in JBoss 7..
The Java EE agent goto URL can now be modified (OPENAM-1299).
The Apache Tomcat policy agent now supports Tomcat 7 as well (OPENAM-1273).
Java EE policy agents can now conditionally redirect users based on the incoming request URL (OPENAM-1265).
The auto-submitting form in FormLoginContent.txt now parses as valid XML (OPENAM-674).

section.title: Before You Install OpenAM Java EE Policy Agents
section.para: This section covers software and hardware prerequisites for installing and running OpenAM Java EE Policy Agents.
If you have a special request to support a combination not listed here, contact ForgeRock at info@forgerock.com.

section.title: Java EE Agents Java Requirements
section.para: Java EE policy agents run in a Java EE Web container. Please review the OpenAM Release Notes for the currently supported version of Java. ForgeRock recommends the most recent update of the installed version of Java to ensure you have the latest security fixes.
ForgeRock has tested this release with Oracle Java SE JDK.

section.title: Java EE Agents Platform Requirements
section.para: Apache Tomcat Java EE policy agents have been tested on Linux 2.6 or later, and on Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2.
GlassFish Java EE policy agents have been tested on Oracle Solaris 10 or later.
Other Java EE policy agents have been tested on Linux 2.6 or later.
Testing has focused on 64-bit operating systems.

section.title: Java EE Agents Hardware Requirements
section.para: You can deploy OpenAM Java EE policy agents on any hardware supported for the combination of software required.
ForgeRock has tested this release on x86 and x64 based systems.

section.title: Limitations
section.para: Not all features of OpenAM Java EE policy agents work with IPv6.

Apache Tomcat can fail to shut down properly when the Java EE policy agent for Tomcat is deployed. To work around this limitation, add the following to your Tomcat configuration in the <Server port="8005" shutdown="SHUTDOWN"> section.
